projects.title: BSc Thesis: AR Escape Room
projects.description:
This is my BSc Thesis for University of Piraeus, Greece.

Design and development of an augmented reality game, using Unity3D and Vuforia. The game application scans and recognizes printed patterns through camera, enabling the user to navigate through rooms, search them for hidden objects and solve riddles in order to successfully finish the game. (Concept inspired by Escape the Room games)

An AR Paper and and AR cube are used.
The AR paper acts as the scene. A shader used to cut any scene elements that fall outside of the AR paper bounds.
The AR cube acts as the selected inventory item, which you can inspect by rotating it in your hand or used by placing objects in the scene to solve puzzles.

images.description: Area 1 open door and view of Area 3.
Area 1 gameplay in the real world using an android device. Normals are inverted to be able to see the scene from whichever angle desired.
Area 3 gameplay in the real world using an android device. Normals are inverted to be able to see the scene from whichever angle desired.
Holding an AR cube with a point of view puzzle. Normals are inverted to give the illusion of the physical cube being hollow.
Holding an AR cube with a solved point of view puzzle. Normals are inverted to give the illusion of the physical cube being hollow.
Open chest. You can see the AR paper sued more clearly here.
Area 2 with open chest gameplay in the real world using an android device
Area 2 with empty open chest gameplay in the real world using an android device

Holding an AR cube with a flashlight inside. Light from the flashlight (in AR cube) affects the scene (AR paper) in order to light up puzzle items in the shadows. Normals are inverted to give the illusion of the physical cube being hollow.

Holding an AR cube with a flashlight inside. Light from the flashlight (in AR cube) affects the scene (AR paper) in order to light up puzzle items in the shadows. Normals are inverted to give the illusion of the physical cube being hollow.
Up close view of the assembled and combined 4 planks that give the code solution for the chest with the orange padlock (indicated by the orange circle).
Up close view (flipped view) of the assembled and combined 4 planks that give the code solution. This is a skewed point of view puzzle.
Area 1 with the rail being placed in the missing spot. Not welded in with the rest yet.

Area 1 with the rail being placed in the missing spot. Not welded in with the rest yet. Blowtorch can be seen equiped and inside the AR cube. It needs to be physically placed on the unwelded rails in order to weld them.
Area 1 with the rails welded together. Warning message that there is a need to switch the rail path first before continuing.

projects.title: MSc Thesis: Mixed Reality interactive experience using Hololens 2
projects.description:
This is my MSc Thesis for Abertay University, Dundee Scotland.

Design and development of a Mixed Reality interactive experience using the Hololens 2 device and Unity3D. The application enables the scanning and spatial understanding of the real-world room and utilizes it to spawn cockroaches on its floor and walls. The user can interact with the cockroaches using their hands or by using their eyes. The cockroaches can move on the floor and walls, can follow the user, produce 3d sounds, move between different planes (from the wall, to the user’s hand), stand on the user's hand and be interacted with.

images.description: Holding a cockroach at the palm of my hand.
Cockroach transitioning from the wall to my hand.
Cockroached following me in the room.

videos.description: Video showcasing my MSc Thesis for Abertay University Dundee. This video was part of my thesis presentation.

projects.title: Lost In Dimension
projects.description:
Group project submission for the “Online Together Jam” about a multiplayer game involving a mentor and a student focused in communication between them.

One player controls the girl character and can move her around the room, while also interacting with objects.
The other player controls the ghost boy that is only able to learn and interact with the world by using the text adventure style interface.
Each player can see and interact with things that the other player can't, and so they need to communicate with each other in order to solve the puzzles.

Developed the top-down gameplay part, networking and some UI, while another programmer developed the text-based part.

You can download the project using the itch.io link below.

images.description: Room 2, girl perspective. Entering a code to a hidden safe that the boy hinted at.
Room 2, girl perspective. Solving a logic puzzle.
Room 2, boy perspective. After the safe is opened.

projects.title: MSc Project: AI Rocket Genetic Algorithms
projects.description:
Game Simulation of Genetic Algorithms for Rocket Navigation.

This project involves a game simulation that utilizes genetic algorithms to guide rockets through an obstacle course. The simulation serves as a practical application of genetic algorithms, demonstrating their efficacy in real-time decision-making and path optimization. Built primarily in Unity3D and C#, the project showcases not only advanced algorithmic problem-solving but also integrates game physics for a more realistic navigation experience.

You can download the project using the itch.io link below.

images.description: Training settings one the left and training view on the right.
Training information one the left and training view on the right.

projects.title: MSc Project: Reinforcement Qlearning Rocket
projects.description:
Game Simulation of Reinforcement Q-Learning for Rocket Navigation.

This project is a game simulation that leverages Reinforcement Q-Learning algorithm to autonomously guide a rocket through a field of obstacles.
Developed in Unity3D and C#, the simulation serves as a hands-on exploration of machine learning techniques applied to real-time navigation challenges.
The rocket's path is continuously optimized through Q-Learning, adapting to new obstacles and conditions, thereby showcasing the algorithm's capabilities in a gaming environment.

You can download the project using the itch.io link below.

images.description: Training settings one the left and training view on the right.
Training information one the left and training view on the right.

projects.title: MSc Project: Bomberman Multiplayer
projects.description:
Top-Down Online Multiplayer Survival Game.

This project is a top-down online multiplayer game, accommodating up to four players, developed in Unity3D and C#.
In this arena-based game, players navigate through a maze of walls, strategically placing bombs that detonate after a set time.
Walls within the arena can shield players from bomb impacts, adding a layer of strategy.
When a player is caught in a bomb's blast radius, they are eliminated, and the player who placed the bomb earns points.
Players can also accumulate points by collecting coins scattered throughout the arena. The game concludes when either one player remains or someone reaches a predetermined point threshold.
Real-time network communication is facilitated through .NET sockets, ensuring a smooth and interactive multiplayer experience.

You can download the project using the itch.io link below.

images.description: Found enough players to join the game and waiting for more possible players.
